title.span: IBM® RMF for z/OS Grafana App

shortdesc.p: This article covers the new features, system requirements, and known issues of the IBM® RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin.

topicmeta.shortdesc: This article covers the new features, system requirements, and known issues of the IBM RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin.

shortdesc.p: This section provides a detailed overview of the IBM® RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin and its various features and capabilities.

topicmeta.shortdesc: This section provides a detailed overview of the IBM® RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin and its various features and capabilities.

topic.title: Visualization of RMF Monitor III metrics in Grafana

shortdesc.p: Grafana is a platform for monitoring and visualizing data. It enables users to create, explore, and share dashboards that are interactive and customizable. The IBM® RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin provides effortless analysis and visualization of z/OS Resource Measurement Facility (RMF) Monitor III metrics and reports within the Grafana platform. Thereby, you can monitor and analyze the health and performance of applications.

topicmeta.navtitle: Visualization of RMF Monitor III metrics in Grafana
topicmeta.linktext: Visualization of RMF Monitor III metrics in Grafana
topicmeta.shortdesc: Grafana is a platform for monitoring and visualizing data. It enables users to create, explore, and share dashboards that are interactive and customizable. The IBM RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin provides effortless analysis and visualization of z/OS Resource Measurement Facility (RMF) Monitor III metrics and reports within the Grafana platform. Thereby, you can monitor and analyze the health and performance of applications.

topic.title: IBM® RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin

shortdesc.p: IBM® RMF for z/OS Grafana App is a plugin for Grafana that provides custom panels for RMF data source. It consists of RMF Charts, RMF Reporting, and RMF Time Series dashboards.

topicmeta.navtitle: IBM RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin
topicmeta.linktext: IBM RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin
topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM RMF for z/OS Grafana App is a plugin for Grafana that provides custom panels for RMF data source. It consists of RMF Charts, RMF Reporting, and RMF Time Series dashboards.

shortdesc.p: In Grafana, queries are essential for fetching and transforming data from RMF data sources.

topicmeta.shortdesc: In Grafana, queries are essential for fetching and transforming data from RMF data sources.

shortdesc.p: You must install the IBM® RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin to analyze and visualize RMF Monitor III metrics and reports.

topicmeta.shortdesc: You must install the IBM RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin to analyze and visualize RMF Monitor III metrics and reports.

shortdesc.p: To access RMF Monitor III metrics in Grafana, you need to connect to the Distributed Data Servers by adding an RMF data source.

topicmeta.shortdesc: To access RMF Monitor III metrics in Grafana, you need to connect to the Distributed Data Servers by adding an RMF data source.

shortdesc.p: Grafana provides a highly flexible and customizable dashboard consisting of one or more rows and panels.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Grafana provides a highly flexible and customizable dashboard consisting of one or more rows and panels.

shortdesc.p: To understand your data better, you must create a dashboard that displays different charts, statistics, and tables. This can give you more insight into your data.

topicmeta.shortdesc: To understand your data better, you must create a dashboard that displays different charts, statistics, and tables. This can give you more insight into your data.

shortdesc.p: You can mange the dashboard to perform various tasks such as creating a folder or a dashboard, moving dashboards into folders, deleting multiple dashboards, and navigating to a folder page where you can assign folder and dashboard permissions.

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can mange the dashboard to perform various tasks such as creating a folder or a dashboard, moving dashboards into folders, deleting multiple dashboards, and navigating to a folder page where you can assign folder and dashboard permissions.

shortdesc.p: By adding panels to dashboards, you can effectively present your data in a visual format. Each panel must require at least one query to display a significant visualization.

topicmeta.shortdesc: By adding panels to dashboards, you can effectively present your data in a visual format. Each panel must require at least one query to display a significant visualization.

shortdesc.p: You can transform your data by renaming fields, joining time series data, and performing mathematical operations across queries.

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can transform your data by renaming fields, joining time series data, and performing mathematical operations across queries.

shortdesc.p: Variables are a powerful tool to create more interactive and dynamic dashboards. They offer a way to replace hard-coded values in metric queries and panel titles with placeholders for values.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Variables are a powerful tool to create more interactive and dynamic dashboards. They offer a way to replace hard-coded values in metric queries and panel titles with placeholders for values.

shortdesc.p: Grafana Alerting feature provides a reliable solution to detect and respond to system issues in real time.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Grafana Alerting feature provides a reliable solution to detect and respond to system issues in real time.

shortdesc.p: You can create an alert rule to determine when an alert should be triggered. It comprises one or more queries and expressions over which the condition must be satisfied for the alert to start triggering.

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can create an alert rule to determine when an alert should be triggered. It comprises one or more queries and expressions over which the condition must be satisfied for the alert to start triggering.

shortdesc.p: You can set up contact points to specify how contacts receive notifications when an alert rule is triggered.

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can set up contact points to specify how contacts receive notifications when an alert rule is triggered.

shortdesc.p: When you use IBM® z/OS Management Facility to monitor the performance of the z/OS sysplexes in your environment, you can also access Grafana dashboards from z/OSMF.

topicmeta.linktext: Grafana through IBM z/OS Management Facility
topicmeta.shortdesc: When you use IBM z/OS Management Facility to monitor the performance of the z/OS sysplexes in your environment, you can also access Grafana dashboards from z/OSMF.

shortdesc.p: You must define the Grafana server as a target system in z/OSMF to access Grafana from the Resource Monitoring page of z/OSMF.

topicmeta.shortdesc: You must define the Grafana server as a target system in z/OSMF to access Grafana from the Resource Monitoring page of z/OSMF.

shortdesc.p: You can access the Grafana dashboard from the Resource Monitoring page of z/OSMF to investigate the RMF Monitor III metrics and reports.

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can access the Grafana dashboard from the Resource Monitoring page of z/OSMF to investigate the RMF Monitor III metrics and reports.

shortdesc.p: In Grafana, you can collect historical data using absolute and relative time ranges.

topicmeta.shortdesc: In Grafana, you can collect historical data using absolute and relative time ranges.

shortdesc.p: Whenever you encounter issues while using the IBM® RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin, you can view detailed error messages that contain sufficient information to help you identify and troubleshoot the problem.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Whenever you encounter issues while using the IBM RMF for z/OS Grafana App plugin, you can view detailed error messages that contain sufficient information to help you identify and troubleshoot the problem.
